DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Injury Infectious Disorder Observed Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator to the observation of an adverse event of a damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Injury Infectious Disorder Observed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the observation of an adverse event of a damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.  A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.:A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.:Ascertained or determined through monitoring or observation.

Concepts.definition: Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.
A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.
Ascertained or determined through monitoring or observation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, Unknown, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did patient experience Grade
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient experience Grade 3 or higher wound infection (requiring IV antibiotics)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient experience grade 3 or higher infection during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: During this reporting period, did patient experience any grade 3 or higher infections that occurred more than 30 days after the last administration of blinatumomab?
